programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The all-stars are given $20 to buy ingredients for restaurant-quality pasta dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The all-stars face three difficult challenges for the coveted black jacket.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs instruct famous athletes to make their signature dishes using only verbal instructions.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: As their families visit, the chefs must base a dish on a secret ingredient hidden in a gift chosen by them.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon shows us how to make his ultimate food on a budget. Recipes include flavourful sausage rice, roasted mackerel with garlic and paprika and unforgettable lamb with fried bread.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon turns his focus to home baking. Recipes include his flavour-packed olive, tomato and rosemary focaccia, quick flatbreads with lemon, thyme and ricotta and a spectacular sponge with fresh ginger.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula's daughter-in-law, Claudia, takes over Paula's kitchen once again for a vegan-inspired lunch.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Renowned Chocolatier, Adam Turoni, shows Paula the artistry of some of his most decadent chocolate creations that are easier than any cook could make.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula cooks her traditional vegetable beef soup, staying faithful to the family recipe.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Fried foods should be golden brown and never greasy. Martha deep-fries and pan-fries to perfection: French fries, panfried chicken, and Japanese tempura vegetables.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: A beautifully cooked roast makes a grand centerpiece for any dinner. Martha shares techniques for prime rib roast, crown roast of pork, and stuffed turkey breast.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Hearty stews are made with inexpensive cuts of meat and require little hands-on prep time. Martha demonstrates three classic recipes: beef stew, coq au vin, and veal stew.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and Abita CEO Dave Blossman as they explore a menu inspired by his beers. Get ready to try Creole Duck Breast with Beer and Cherry Glaze and Bratwurst Cooked in Beer with Apple Sauerkraut.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and Voodoo priestesses Brandi and Maggie as they explore a menu inspired by their annual Voodoo Fest in New Orleans. Get ready to try BlackEyed Pea Jambalaya and Ham Hock and Cabbage Soup.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and young chef CJ Calhoun for a meal any kid would love! Dig into Bacon and Herb Roast Turkey Breast, Oven Roasted Crispy Broccoli, and end with Caramelized Sweet Potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget make Pub-Style Steak and Ale Pie and Keith makes Boston Brown Bread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Elle makes the ultimate Deviled Pork Chops and Lan makes Thick-Cut Oven Fries.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to making Foolproof All-Butter Pie Dough and Chocolate Cream Pie.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget make Roast Chicken with Warm Bread Salad. Elle makes Brussels Sprouts with Peanuts and Mint

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Far from traditional, Paula teaches guest chef Jenna Kinard the path to the perfect meatball.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula demonstrates creative ways to prepare three classic steaks.

programme.desc: Martha and her friends make three pasta dishes.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Join Emeril and his friends Maggie Long and Cyrus Lester in the kitchen as he builds a meal around the fresh and delicious mushrooms from their farm.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s guide to the ultimate home cooking continues as he shows us how to make deliciously healthy food.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay shows us how to make his favourite street food dishes at home. Recipes include delicious prawn tostada and irresistible caramel salted popcorn.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon shows us his favourite recipes for an Italian breakfast, lunch and dinner. Dishes include a fennel sausage frittata, griddled sardines with gremolata.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Teams create a holiday platter representing three major holidays: July 4th, Cinco de Mayo and Mardi Gras.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay takes the remaining contestants to the supermarket for another grocery challenge.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: At Olde Hitching Post, Chef Ramsay calms the owner and delegates duties to the co-owner: his daughter.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Levanti's is run into the ground. To save the day, Chef Ramsay must first mend the owners' relationship.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room where the owner's seven children are tired of management.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to Connecticut's oldest inn, the Curtis House. This historic inn has been run by the Hardisty family for generations, but the business has started to fall apart and the family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call daddy), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a Caribbean style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida where the young inexperienced owner, Brian is making guests' time at the hotel miserable with filthy rooms, late night concerts and shocking service.

programme.title: The Southern Weekend
programme.desc: Natalie Stovall visits Walker County, do some shopping and visit Ernest Tubb Record Shop in Nashville.

programme.title: The Southern Weekend
programme.desc: Host Natalie Stovall sits down with The Swon Brothers at Gruhn Guitars.
